snippet: Under new security measures at the Kentucky Derby, horses will be under 24-hour surveillance and those with access to the horses must log in and log out. Expanded drug testing also will be in place.
abstract: Kentucky Derby officials are enforcing new security measures for 2013 contest, under which horses will have 24-hour surveillance and those with access to horses must log in and log out; expanded drug testing will be in place.
lead_paragraph: Under new security measures at the Kentucky Derby, horses will be under 24-hour surveillance and those with access to the horses must log in and log out. Expanded drug testing also will be in place.

headline.main: Mindful of Drugs, Race Officials Will Keep Closer Eye on Kentucky Derby
